post.description: Upload UEFI firmware in UEFI capsule format

requestBody.description:
Uploads an UEFI firmware in UEFI capsule format to the ctrlX OS Device. The update can be executed using the corresponding task.
The UEFI firmware file will be deleted after a execution of the firmware update or if the device has been restarted. In the later case the file has to be uploaded again to execute the firmware update.

400.description: The request is incomplete or malformed

401.description: Not authorized to access this resource

415.description: The request content format is not supported

500.description: Something unexpected happened on the server

sort.description:
Sort the ressource by the given field.
Multiple fields can be chained by adding the query parameter multiple times.
Format is fieldname prefixed with + (ascending) or (descending) -. E.g. +id or -id.
If no prefix is given it defaults to +.
sort.name: sort

limit.description: Maximum number of elements per page.
limit.name: limit

queryLanguage.description: Language as ISO 639-1 language code (e.g. en, de ...). If header and query parameter are set, the query parameter takes precedence over the header parameter
queryLanguage.name: language

headerLanguage.description: Language as ISO 639-1 language code (e.g. en, de ...). If header and query parameter are set, the query parameter takes precedence over the header parameter
headerLanguage.name: Accept-Language

id.description: Package id concated from type, name and version

link.description: Link to the product description or documentation

installed.description: Flag that describes if the package is installed on the current system

base.description: The base app of the current app

required.description: App is required and cannot be removed from system

url.description: Relative path that the service is requesting

binding.description: The network socket or unix socket

PackageTypes.description: List of available package component types

UpdateBehavior.description: The update behavior of a package

id.description: A server generated ID used to identify the task. This ID is unique.

action.description: The action name executed by this task. This has to be inherited and overwritten by the application.

progress.description: Optional progress of the task in percentage.

parameters.description: Optional map of additional parameters required by the request. Should be defined when inherited by an application.

result.description: Optional map reflecting the result of the task. May be empty until task completition. Should be defined when inherited by an application.

TaskReduced.description: Reduced tasks object (result if no user is logged in)

id.description: The temporary id of a task

properties.description: Additional properties of the task object set by the service executing the task

TaskInstall.description: Install an app on the system

TaskUpdate.description: Update an app on the system

TaskUninstall.description: Uninstall an app from the system

TaskEnable.description: Enable an app of the app

TaskDisable.description: Disable an app of the app

TaskStart.description: Start an app or deamon on the system

TaskStop.description: Stop an app or deamon on the system

TaskRestart.description: Restart an app or deamon on the system

TaskRemodel.description:
Start the remodelling process of the device.
Remodelling upgrades the base of a device e.g. from core20 to core22

Problem.description: This document defines a "problem detail" as a way  to carry machine-readable details of errors in a  HTTP response to avoid the need to define new error  response formats for HTTP APIs.

type.description:
A URI reference [RFC3986] that identifies the problem type. 
This specification encourages that, when dereferenced, 
it provide human-readable documentation for the problem type 
(e.g., using HTML [W3C.REC-html5-20141028]). When this member 
is not present, its value is assumed to be "about:blank".

title.description:
A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. 
It SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem, 
except for purposes of localization (e.g., using proactive content 
negotiation; see [RFC7231], Section 3.4).
If the response is a diagnostics message, it contains 
the text associated with the mainDiagnosisCode.
title.example: You do not have enough credit.

status.description:
The HTTP status code ([RFC7231], Section 6) generated by the 
origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.description:
A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.
If the response is a diagnostics message, it contains the text associated with
the detailedDiagnosisCode.
detail.example: Your current balance is 30, but that costs 50.

instance.description:
A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.
It may or may not yield further information if dereferenced.

code.description:
An error code issued by the system that caused the original problem.
This code can be used to track down the root cause of the error.

mainDiagnosisCode.description:
The main diagnosis code is issued by the system that caused the problem.
This code can be used to track down the root cause and source of the error.
It can be used to search in the documentation for a solution.
It SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the same problem.

detailedDiagnosisCode.description:
The detailed diagnosis code issued by the system that caused the problem.
This code can be used to track down the detailed cause and source of the error.
It can be used to search in the documentation for a solution.
The detailed diagnosis code gives additional information about the cause of the error.
It SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the same problem.

dynamicDescription.description:
A dynamic description gives detailed information about the occurrence of a problem.
It can change between different occurrences of the same error.

severity.description: Severity of a problem as defined RFC5424 of the Syslog standard, see https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5424

links.description:
Collection of links to fix the problem. E.g. links to online user manual,
to an online community (using tags) or a developer chat (e.g. Slack).

moreInfo.description:
The moreInfo field allows you to add additional information that might be necessary to debug or trace down the cause of an error.
It might also contain information what is needed to resolve the problem.
There are loosely specified fields for specific problems that can be used in these situations, e.g.:
- On a 403 Forbidden error: The moreInfo can contain a field "requiredPermissions" with the required permissions seperated by comma
- On a 402 Payment required: The moreInfo can contain a field "requiredLicenses" with the required licenses seperated by comma

cause.description:
Sometimes a problem might be caused by problems that occure in other components or are the root cause of a problem. In this
case the related problems can be added as a cause. Since it might be possible that multiple components have problems on a single
action, cause is an array. E.g. Loading failed because several components where not able to load the configuration.

Settings.description: Settings for app and package management

allowUnknownApps.description: Allow the installation of apps and packages from unknown source. This is required for installation over Offline Store.

purgeVersions.description: Remove old versions after successful update

reachable.description: Flag indicating if the store is reachable

roundTripTime.description: Roundtrip time for a request to the store in ms

remodelable.description:
Checks if all preconditions are fulfilled. Preconditions are: right core version is installed, gadget contains model assertion,
serial assertion is available and all apps defined in model assertion are installed with the future base version.

updatable.description: Checks if an uefi update is available

Rexroth-Remoteagent.description: Provides information for ctrlX Remote Agent regarding the current app, e.g. supported commands.

commands.description: Supported ctrlX Device Portal commands that are handled by this app and are forwarded by ctrlX Remote Agent.

Commands.description: Supported ctrlX Device Portal commands that are handled by this app and are forwarded by ctrlX Remote Agent.

Rexroth-Setup.description: Provides information for ctrlX Setup regarding the current app, e.g. settings to be saved and restored.

settings.description: App settings to be saved and restored by ctrlX Setup

Licenses.description: Contains license informations for specific rexroth apps

Dependencies.description: Contains app dependencies for current app

ScopesDeclaration.description: Contains a list of all available scopes for the current app

order.description: The sort order of the component.

src.description: The url of the web component's implementation file.

tag.description: The tag name that creates a new instance of the web component.

id.description: Serves as the identifier of this command; must be unique within the enclosing scope.

subject.description:
Denotes what will be saved or loaded; used to inform users, e.g. in messages like "Loading motion settings"
or "Cannot load motion settings".

after.description: Defines a list of command identifiers whose commands if present will always be executed before this command.

url.description:
The URL used in POST requests to process the command.
URLs starting with a slash are interpreted to be relative to https://<host>.
The execution and url elements are mutually exclusive, that is exactly one of them is required.

example.name: Package Manager API
example.description: Provides package management related functionalities on ctrlX OS devices.

type.description: The type or category of the document

url.description: The path to the document resource

description.description: Short description of the purpose of the document
description.example: Provides package management related functionalities on ctrlX OS devices.

AppDirectory.description: Describes an app directory stored as part of a configuration.

name.description: Path of the app directory in the configuration.

description.description: Short description of the directory content (visible in the Solutions UI).

icon.description: An optional icon representing the app.

permissions.description: Permissions are deprecated and no longer have effect.

scopes.description: Scopes are deprecated and no longer have effect.

copyOnLoad.description: If true, the copy operation is done by the Solutions app; otherwise, by the app itself.

writeProtected.description: If true, the directory is protected against changes through WebDAV or the Solutions UI.

name.description: Name of the app, i.e. the name of the executable.

aliases.description: A list of alias names for this app (optional).

common-id.description: A common ID associated with this app (optional)

desktop-file.description: Path to desktop file for this app (optional)

name.description:
Name of the setting. Must be unique within the app's settings list.
Serves as key in the ctrlx-setup.json file.
Required for all types except 'snapshot'.
Note that the name '$path' is reserved.

description.description: Short localized description of the setting.

url.description:
URL used to read (GET) and update (PUT) the setting. A URL starting
with a slash is interpreted to be relative to https://<host>.
Required for all types except 'snapshot'.

type.description:
Type of the setting. One of 'text', 'json', 'file', 'encryptedFile' and 'snapshot'.
The default is 'text'.

title.description: Human readable title of the firewall

required.description: Indicates if an licenses is required to operate the application or unlocks optional functionalities

title.description: The widget's title as shown in the widget catalog.

description.description: The widget's description as shown in the widget catalog.
description.example: Shows the status of your axes

icon.description: The icon to be displayed in the widget catalog.

image.description: The path to the image to be displayed in the widget catalog.

permissions.description: List of permissions to view or interact with the widget.

categories.description: List of categories the widget is displayed

settingsTag.description: The tag name of the web component, which provides the settings editor for the widget.

noInitialCreation.description: If true, the widget isn't created initially.

cols.description: Number of columns in the dashboard grid.

rows.description: Number of rows in the dashboard grid.

SnapDaemonType.description: The type of daemon this app is. One of "simple", "forking", "oneshot", "dbus" or "notify" (optional, only applicable for daemons).

header.description: Web components that should be displayed in the global header.

dashboard.description: Web components that should be displayed in the dashboard.

PackageManifest_commands_activeConfigura.description: Commands relating to the active configuration (app.solutions).

save.description:
The commands to be processed in order to save app runtime data
into the file system of the control.

load.description:
The commands to be processed in order to load app runtime data
from the file system of the control.

PackageManifest_commands.description:
Allows to specify commands that integrate into framework operations, e.g. for persisting data.
The sub-elements define the scopes that support command integration.

appDirectories.description: Describes app directories and specifies access to them inside the configuration

required.description:
Indicates if a package is required by the system. A required snap can not be
removed from the device. It still can be updated.

enabled.description: Flag that describes if the package is enabled.

display-name.description: The display name of the publisher.

apps.description: JSON array of apps the snap provides. See below for fields.

broken.description: A string describing if this snap is not working.

channel.description: The channel the snap is currently installed from.

channels.description: JSON array of channels the snap is available in. See below for fields.

common-ids.description: JSON array of common-ids the snap provides. See below for fields.

confinement.description: The confinement level the snap is currently installed with.

contact.description: The contact email address for the snap.

description.example: A secure, minimal transactional OS for devices and containers.

devmode.description: True if the snap is currently installed in development mode.

enabled.description: True if the snap is currently enabled.

icon.description: A URL to an icon for the snap.

install-date.description: The date and time when the snap was installed in RFC3339 UTC format.

installed.description: True if the snap is currently installed.

installed-size.description: How much space (in bytes) the snap itself (not its data) uses.

jailmode.description: True if the app is currently installed in jail mode.

private.description: True if the snap is private.

required.description: True if the snap is required.

resource.description: A URL to a resource for the snap.

summary.description: A short description of the app.

tracking-channel.description: The channel updates will be installed from.

trymode.description: True if the app was installed in try mode.

updateBehavior.description: The update behavior of the snap.

id.description: id of the package (app) that should be installed from the given location. The id consists of the type, e.g. snap, and the technology-specific primary identifier, e.g. snap name.

location.description: location of the snap to install

id.description: id of the installed package (app) that should be updated from the given location. The id consists of the type, e.g. snap, and the technology-specific primary identifier, e.g. snap name.

location.description: location of the snap to install

id.description: id of the installed package (app) that should be uninstalled. The id consists of the type, e.g. snap, and the technology-specific primary identifier, e.g. snap name.
id of the installed package (app) that should be enabled. The id consists of the type, e.g. snap, and the technology-specific primary identifier, e.g. snap name.
id of the installed package (app) that should be disabled. The id consists of the type, e.g. snap, and the technology-specific primary identifier, e.g. snap name.

service.description: Service name of app or app name to start

enable.description: Enable state for service - keep service enabled after reboot

service.description: Service name of app or app name to stop

disable.description: Disable state for service - keep service disabled after reboot

service.description: Service name of app or app name to restart

reload.description: Try to reload service if supported, otherwise restart service

Command_execution.description: The execution element is deprecated. Use url element instead.

method.description: The HTTP method called for executing this command; one of "POST" and "PUT"; the default is "POST".

url.description: The URL used for executing this command.

properties.description: Additional properties of the task object set by the service executing the task
